channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-13496] NullPointerException in JSONWriter.writeSolrDocument
item.description:
For non-grouped searches QueryComponent.regularFinishStage already considers the possibility of null SolrDocument values due to an index change.

For grouped searches GroupedEndResultTransformer.transform potentially adds a null element to a SolrDocumentList.

The TextResponseWriter.writeSolrDocumentList method passes any null SolrDocument through to the JSONWriter.writeSolrDocument method leading to a NullPointerException at line 87.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Attached patch proposes to null-check in GroupedEndResultTransformer.transform before adding to the list.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.

The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests. Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch. Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

Just attached a patch which includes (a tidied up version of) my (new) ChaoticDistributedGroupingTest used to exercise the code path in question. The test configures a custom select handler which configures a TargettedChaosComponent search component which in its modifyRequest method potentially modifies the ids parameter of a shard request. That removal of an id value is to simulate a Solr cloud scenario where a document is deleted just before a 'get fields' request for it happens.

Having said all that (unless anyone strongly thinks otherwise) I'm not planning on including the new ChaoticDistributedGroupingTest in the commit for this ticket here since just under 200 lines of non-trivial test code for essentially a one-line change to add a null-check seems excessive?

-1 overall

... Failed junit tests solr.SolrInfoBeanTest ...

I think that's unrelated to the change proposed here. SOLR-13518 just opened to improve the debuggability of that test.

... I think that's unrelated ... SOLR-13518 just opened to improve the debuggability of that test.

Actually the bot was right and the SOLR-13518 change helps to make it easier to see why, it was basically saying that ChaoticDistributedGroupingTest.TargettedChaosComponent.getDescription returning null is not okay.

Will attach revised patch for a QA re-run (but as mentioned above am still not intending to commit the ChaoticDistributedGroupingTest test itself).
